description: To address CVE-2023-36424, several updates are available for impacted Windows systems, including build numbers for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Specifically, updates include KB5032199, KB5032192, KB5032190, and KB5032189. Administrators can find the appropriate packages and apply them by accessing the links: https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5032197, https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5032192, https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5032199, https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5032254, https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5032249, https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5032196, https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5032252, https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5032198, https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5032247, and https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5032190. It's important for system administrators to ensure their environments are running the correct builds such as 10.0.22621.2715 for Windows 11 Version 23H2 or 10.0.19045.3693 for Windows 10 Version 22H2 to successfully mitigate this issue. Regularly checking for updates is recommended to safeguard systems effectively.
